conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway/isometric view with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible interior volumes, multiple faces per wall, and ceiling/roof removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clean corners and readable room volumes; mild softness/simplification of some wall edges/openings but overall correct 3D treatment and cutaway.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency largely match (bedrooms, bath, living, kitchen/dining). Some proportional drift in corridor/central space and several door/window placements/sizes appear simplified or not fully matching the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture blocks present in expected rooms (beds, sofa, dining table, kitchen run, bathroom fixtures). Some items are simplified and a few pieces (e.g., desk/wardrobes) are not as clearly represented as in 2D.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render, good contrast and readability of walls/floors/openings; lighting is adequate and background is uncluttered. Minor ambiguity in door geometry due to uniform material and soft shadows.

detected_errors.description: Minor-to-moderate proportional/layout drift: the central circulation space and some partition lengths differ from the 2D plan, reducing exact fidelity.
Doors/windows are present but several openings look simplified; exact placement and proportional sizing do not fully align with the 2D plan.
Furniture is simplified into generic blocks; some 2D-indicated furnishings (e.g., certain storage/desk details) are not clearly matched.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong spatial readability and largely correct room layout, but with noticeable simplifications and some proportional/opening mismatches versus the 2D plan.
